ORDER

Dated this the 8" day of January , 2024

This Crl.M.C., under Section 482 of Cr.P.C., is
filed by the first accused in crime No.978 of 2023 of
Valiyathura Police Station, Thiruvananthapuram, for a
direction to the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-XI,
Thiruvananthapuram, to permit the petitioner to execute
bail bond as per Annexure Al order dated 09.11.2023,
after accepting her Aadhar Card as identity proof.

2. According to the petitioner, she has got an alias
name as Abina, and in the FIR, her name and address were
shown as “Abina, D/O Kalapathi, Door No.13, Anna Nagar,
Thuthukudi, Tamil Nadu”. When she produced her Aadhar
Card for executing the bond as per Annexure Ai order, her
address was shown as “A.Nageswari, W/O Arumugam,
10/18, Santhanamariamman  Kovil Street, Vellanguli,
Tirunelveli. Since there was change in the name and
address, learned Magistrate not permitted her to execute

ap

the bond as per Annexure Al order. Learned counsel for
the petitioner would submit that the petitioner filed
Annexure A3 application before Judicial First Class
Magistrate Court-XI, Thiruvananthapuram, for permitting
her to execute the bail bond on accepting her Aadhar Card.

3. Since her address in the FIR and Aadhar Card are
entirely different, learned Magistrate is justified in not
permitting her to execute the bond as per Annexure Al
order. Learned Magistrate has to obtain a report from the
Investigating Officer in crime No.978 of 2023, as to the
correct name and address of the 1* accused in crime
No.978 of 2023, whether she has got an alias name as
‘Abina’ etc. The petitioner is also at liberty to produce ‘one
and the same certificate’ obtained from Village Office
concerned to show that the accused in the FIR and the
person in Annexure A2 Aadhar Card are one and the same
person. Learned Magistrate has to obtain the report from
the Investigating Officer within 10 days from today, and
the petitioner also can produce ‘one and the same
